pullRequest.body:
Currently, an application of an empty vector can't be delaborated well:
```lean
def myFun : Fin 0 → ℕ := fun x => ![] x

#print myFun
/-
def myFun : Fin 0 → ℕ :=
fun x => ![]
-/
```
This PR refactors the delaborators for an empty vector:
```lean
def myFun : Fin 0 → ℕ := fun x => ![] x

#print myFun
/-
def myFun : Fin 0 → ℕ :=
fun x => ![] x
-/
```

nodes.body:
This looks ok, but I'm still confused about whether https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/3375 is relevant here, so I've pinged @kmill for review.

I also wonder if these should be disabled with `pp.explicit`.

Let's keep the app unexpanders, since they work on master:
```lean
def myAppVec2 (x : Fin 2) := ![0, 1] x

#print myAppVec2
/-
def Matrix.myAppVec2 : Fin 2 → ℕ :=
fun x ↦ ![0, 1] x
-/
```

However, the `vecEmpty` unexpander is incorrect and consumes arguments in an overapplication. We can fix it with
```lean
/-- Unexpander for the `![]` notation. -/
@[app_unexpander vecEmpty]
def vecEmptyUnexpander : Lean.PrettyPrinter.Unexpander
  | `($_:ident) => `(![])
  | _ => throw ()
```
and then we can see
```lean
def myAppVec0 (x : Fin 0) := (![] : Fin 0 → Nat) x

#print myAppVec0
/-
def Matrix.myAppVec0 : Fin 0 → ℕ :=
fun x ↦ ![] x
-/
```

Could we change this PR to be one that fixes `vecEmpty` and adds these examples to a test file?

:v: Komyyy can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8964393669/job/24616113456)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8964393669/job/24616113584)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8964393669/job/24616113880)

Let's use `#guard_msgs` instead of using a custom testing command.

I didn't test this (I'm guessing the docstring), and you'll probably have to use the code action for `#guard_msgs` to update it.
```suggestion
/-- info: fun x => ![0, 1] x : Fin 2 → ℕ -/
#guard_msgs in #check fun x => (![0, 1] : Fin 2 → ℕ) x
```

(By the way, there are some bugs in `#guard_delab`. The first line should be something like `let e₁ ← instantiateMVars <| ← withSynthesize <| Term.elabTerm t₁ none`, but it's better that we don't spend time debugging it and instead use the pre-existing tool.)
I think you also should set `set_option pp.unicode.fun false` at the top of this file so that the test file runs the same both in the IDE and in CI.

These can probably be removed now.

Please make sure to change the PR title to something like ``fix: pretty print `vecEmpty` as `![]` even when applied`` and update the PR description.

Once you address these things, it's ready to merge. Thanks!

bors d+

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix: pretty print `vecEmpty` as `![]` even when applied
